data.title: International Organizations
data.meta_description: North Korean membership in international organizations is organized by category below.
data.text:
North Korea is not a member of most international financial institutions, including the World Bank, International Monetary Fund, Asian Development Bank, or Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank. North Korea is also not a member of the World Trade Organization, World Customs Organization, or the International Labor Organization.

North Korea is not a party to several international institutions focused on arms control and nonproliferation, such as the Organization for the Prohibition for Chemical Weapons, the Wassenaar Arrangement, or the Missile Technology Control Regime. North Korea withdrew from the IAEA in 1994.

Although North Korea is a member of the ASEAN Regional Forum, it is not a participant in the East Asia Summit.
